data.quote: If it's a good idea, go ahead and do it. It's much easier to apologize than it is to get permission.
data.author: Grace Hopper

data.quote: What you do has far greater impact than what you say
data.author: Stephen Covey

data.quote: Ninety percent of leadership is the ability to communicate something people want.
data.author: Dianne Feinstein

data.quote: An organization’s ability to learn, and translate that learning into action rapidly, is the ultimate competitive advantage
data.author: Jack Welch

data.quote: It’s fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.
data.author: Bill Gates

data.quote: It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that, you’ll do things differently.
data.author: Warren Buffett

data.quote: Outstanding leaders go out of the way to boost the self-esteem of their personnel. If people believe in themselves, it’s amazing what they can accomplish.
data.author: Sam Walton

data.quote: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
data.author: Peter F. Drucker

data.quote: You don’t have to hold a position in order to be a leader.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: We do not need magic to change the world, we carry all the power we need inside ourselves already: we have the power to imagine better.
data.author: J.K. Rowling

data.quote: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
data.author: Chuck Swindoll

data.quote: Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.
data.author: Michael Jordan

data.quote: A man who wants to lead the orchestra must turn his back on the crowd.
data.author: Max Lucado

data.quote: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: Leadership is a matter of having people look at you and gain confidence, seeing how you react. If you’re in control, they’re in control.
data.author: Tom Landry

data.quote: The greatest leader is not necessarily the one who does the greatest things. He is the one that gets the people to do the greatest things.
data.author: Ronald Reagan

data.quote: It took me quite a long time to develop a voice, and now that I have it, I am not going to be silent.
data.author: Madeleine Albright

data.quote: A person always doing his or her best becomes a natural leader, just by example.
data.author: Joe DiMaggio

data.quote: The task of the leader is to get his people from where they are to where they have not been.
data.author: Henry Kissinger

data.quote: When the whole world is silent, even one voice becomes powerful.
data.author: Malala Yousafzai
